wikipedia_page.main: Philip Bayton (born 18 September 1950) is a former road cyclist from Great Britain, who was a professional from 1973 to 1989.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1972 Summer Olympics
Cycling at the 1972 Summer Olympics – Men's individual road race

response: He represented the United Kingdom at the 1972 Summer Olympics in Munich, West Germany, where he finished sixth in the road race, just behind teammate Phil Bayton.
| 1971 || Dave Rollinson || Phil Bayton || Phil Cheetham
| 1982 || Phil Bayton || Phil Corley || Bill Nickson
His cycles were ridden to success by Anthony Taylor,Cycling, 15 November 1969 Paul Carbutt, Roy Cox, Ray Ward, Phil Bayton and others.
